oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Race Relations Conference
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Achieving Recognition
National Leaders
Race relations; African Americans
Men; Women
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: An integrated group of adults seated and standing in front of a brick building with arched doorway.

Dr. Charles S. Johnson, head of Fisk University's Sociology Department, organized the Race Relations Institute in 1944. The workshops of the Race Relations Conference were integrated, and sessions focused on discrimination.
oai_dc:dc.dc:relation: Nashville Room Historic Photographs Collection, Special Collections Division, Nashville Public Library
